The focus paper provide additional calibration data improve accuracy gap test simulations. 6 7 Features Gap Testing The typical gap test arrangement 4 see Figure 1 consists cylindrical Pentolite 50 weight TNT 50 weight PETN explosive donor charge attached Polymethylmethacrylate PMMA cylinder referred gap. The gap composed either single cylinder multiple PMMA cylinders. Attached PMMA cylindrical acceptor explosive typically encased steel tube. The PMMA serves attenuate energy peak pressure transferred acceptor explosive. Below acceptor explosive small air gap steel plate. A full detonation acceptor explosive punches clean hole considered GO steel plate. The test performed multiple times determine maximum gap thickness achieve GO. For thickness greater maximum gap thickness insufcient energy imparted acceptor explosive cause full detonation. Although variety gap tests two types discussed work large-scale gap test LSGT expandedlarge scale gap test ELSGT key difference LSGT ELSGT physical scale 1.875 X. Existing Gap Test Calibration Curves Gap test calibration curves specify peak shock wave pressure PMMA gap PG versus gap thickness. Threshold violence reaction explosives containing cavities adjacent gaps determined compressive loads ranging setback gun projectile supersonic penetration hardened target. Cylindrical samples heavily confined except moveable piston one end. Piston sample pressures always measured along piston motion several experiments follow cavity collapse. With 12.7-mm diameter 6.3-mm deep cylindrical cavity sample 38 explosives examined survived higher loading rates. Usually cast-cure softer pressed explosive would deform without internal damage reaction mild extinguished consuming much sample. Melt-cast harder pressed explosives fracture suddenly vigorously react additional surface area sometimes even exploding. Reaction threshold violence depended energetic ingredients particle size also mechanical properties related type binder fill density. A number operational hazard scenarios involve pressure-time p-t loadings tens microseconds milliseconds peaks tenths GPa. One example inertial loading near bottom explosive fill gun projectile accelerates barrel referred gun setback discussed Detonation Symposia.1-3 Other examples involve impact falling munitions inertial loading explosive fill near nose warhead penetrates barrier. Such loadings well threshold shock initiation dynamic collapse internal cavity cause ignition possibly developing violent reaction. Cavities common include casting voids open cracks aging cycling air gaps interfaces confinement. Since models predicting ignition unavailable full-scale tests expensive difficult instrument simulators used replicate p-t loading within area interest contains cavity. For fill without friction within canister accelerated along axis simplified gun projectile quasi-steady p fill density acceleration fill depth h. In one 127-mm gun projectile example maximum p pmax 88 MPa bottom fill 6.2 ms average loading rate dpdt 14.2 MPams. Summary Conclusions A simulator developed replicating inertial loadings sudden accelerations decelerations explosive fills munitions. apparatus coupled Simulating dynamic load 25.4-mm diameter explosive sample cavity base gap conceptually simple influenced mechanical properties explosives. Similar complexity exists actual munitions. The setback simulator provided repeatable loading rate peak pressure unloading consistent results reaction threshold violence. Whether collapsing defect ignites sample depends size rate collapsed ease deformation condition cavity surface filler particle size. The ability cavity surface entrap bind energetic crystals collapse small crystal size non-cracking binder contribute insensitivity. We studied evolution thermal explosions TATB 135triamino-246-trinitrobenzene based understanding mechanisms behavior determine overall description insensitivity material. We investigated low density samples TATB thermal explosions suite diagnostics including temperature density pressure. These used TATB thermal explosion experiments range initial starting densities. TATB shown slow laminar internal burning lowest densities may exhibit deconsolidative behavior. Cracking steady propagation observed lowest densities studied laminar burning obtained 1.55 gcc. Deconsolidative qualitatively faster response recently observed densities 1.30 gcc. We use understanding mechanism octahydro-1357-tetranitro-1357-tetrazocine formulations inform us TATB deflagration. For instance something like 75 current tests evaluate insensitivity actually tests heat necessarily differences chemical response. Understanding role microstructure plays detonation behavior subject significant body research within detonation physics community. The pursuit understanding important safety performance characteristics shown strongly correlate particle morphology. Historical studies often correlated bulk powder characteristics performance safety characteristics pressed materials. That approach taken recently techniques could precisely characterize pressed microstructure assumed correlation bulk powder pressed microstructure. We believe clearer relevant correlation made pressed microstructure observed detonation behavior. This type assessment possible techniques exist quantification pressed microstructures. This paper report experimental efforts correlate directly measured microstructural characteristics initiation threshold behavior three HMX based materials. The internal microstructures revealed using argon ion cross-sectioning technique. This technique enabled quantification density interface area pores within pressed bed using methods stereology. These bed characteristics compared initiation threshold behavior three HMX based materials using electric gun based test method. A persistent challenge explosive community struggled development means clearly quantify effects microstructure continuum level safety performance characteristics. Historical methods often sought correlate bulk powder characteristics particle size specific surface area continuum level behavior. A review efforts well research methodology directly quantify characteristics pressed microstructure attempt correlate changes continuum level initiation threshold behavior. developed techniques1 allow us generate twodimensional cross sections pellets. along principles borrowed field stereology allow quantification density specific interface area within pores pellets. Here assess ability correlate bed features changes initiation threshold model based upon work James2. In study Honodel et al. evaluated flyers various thicknesses quantify effect pulse duration initiation threshold characteristics. They reported reversal sensitivity considering threshold velocity thickest flyers versus thinnest flyers. The low SSA materials B-226 B-338 B-474 required impact velocities 2.22 kms 2.2 kms 2.3 kms respectively. The highest SSA material B-592 required velocity 2.6 kmsec. differences small given uncertainty reported 0.08 kms 0.2 kms three test cases. For thinnest flyers significant differences observed. The B-592 material required velocity 4.1 kms lower SSA materials B-226 B-338 B-474 required velocities 5.4 kms 5.3 kms 5.35 kms respectively. additional conclusion work substantially critical-energy initiation criterion proposed Walker Wasley. In previous proceeding6 reported use alternate functional form proposed James describe boundary failed successful initiation threshold condition. We chosen exponential form shown equation 1 along supporting relationships. E 2 3 E E exp P pressure Up particle velocity W duration pulse values calculated unreacted explosive. The original hyperbolic initiation threshold function proposed James2 included two fitted constants critical energy fluence Ec critical specific kinetic energy 6c. The exponential form equation 1 relies upon three fitted constants Ec 3c 3a. 3c critical power flux represents critical trigger condition initiation threshold case 6c. The third term 3a controls rapidly function transitions energy fluence Ec limited condition power flux 3c limited condition knee curve. Spectroscopic Analysis Time-Resolved Emission Shocked Explosive Jeffrey J. Kay Brook A. Jilek Ryan R. Wixom Robert Knepper Alex Tappan David L. Damm Sandia National Laboratories Sandia National Laboratories Albuquerque NM 87185 Abstract. We conducted series time-resolved spectroscopic measurements aim characterize first reactions occur shock initiation high explosives. We employ time- wavelength-resolved emission spectroscopy analyze light emitted shocked thin explosive films. This unique combination specially designed samples broadband time-resolved spectrometry allows us capture emission immediately following shock front. In talk present spectrally- temporally-resolved optical emission spectra shocked hexanitroazobenzene HNAB hexanitrostilbene HNS samples. The emission features observed spectra assigned electronic transitions molecular fragments C2 CN NO2 implications findings understanding shock initiation process initiate chemical reactions Understanding mechanism explosives key understanding unique defining property ability undergo rapid explosive decomposition response mechanical stimulus. Although initiation explosives studied experimentally computationally many decades promising theories initiation developed 1-5 nature even first chemical reactions occur shock initiation definitively known. To predictively understand explosives respond shock detailed sequence events occurs shock initiation mechanical deformation energy transfer bond breakage first chemical reactions must understood quantum-mechanical level. theories shock initiation developed. One theory developed Dlott Fayer 1 Tokmakoff Dlott Fayer 2 thermal heating mechanism termed phonon up-pumping explains initiation chemical reactions terms phonon-to-vibrational energy transfer. In mechanism energy transferred lattice phonons molecular vibrations via anharmonically-coupled doorway vibrational modes molecule. explosive molecules vibrational modes molecule bond breakage occurs. Another theory developed Gilman 3-4 Kuklja Kunz 5 Kuklja et al. 6-7 athermal initiation mechanism explains initiation chemical reactions terms pressure-induced band gap closure. Under uniaxial compression crystal lattice difference energy valence conduction bands i.e. band gap decreases allowing spontaneous electronic transitions occur. As transition ground state electronically-excited cyclotrimethylene trinitramine RDX involves promotion bonding electrons antibonding orbitals electronic excitation mechanism instantaneous bond breakage particular homolytic cleavage R-NO2 bond. Both theories cleverly explain various aspects initiation particular sensitization materials defects formation hot spots theories necessarily conflict may occur parallel different stages initiation detonation processes. Our aim eventually test aspects theories information initiation mechanism. In work aim observe products initial reactions occur shock initiation streaked emission spectroscopy 89. In experiments optical emission shocked detonating thin film explosive samples analyzed passing light sequentially spectrometer streak camera wavelength vs. time emitted light. Thin film samples used aid observation obscured larger reacting samples. In spectrograms able identify several reactive intermediate species contours emission bands provides information initial quantum state distribution molecules may assist understanding underlying initiation mechanism. intermediate species In experiments light emitted shocked detonating samples analyzed sequentially spectrometer streak spectrogram emitted light wavelength vs. time. Molecular structure Two sample configurations used experiments. In first configuration Fig. 1a linear strip hexanitroazobenzene HNAB vapor-deposited polycarbonate substrate initiated one end parylene flyer launched exploding foil driven capacitive discharge unit. The impact flyer initiates detonation wave one end film propagates toward opposite end. detonation front passes 1 mm diameter silica fiber Polymicro light collected fiber sent streak spectrometer analysis. In second configuration Fig. 1b thin film hexanitrostilbene HNS vapor-deposited lithium fluoride substrate shocked parylene flyer launched exploding foil. The impact flyer velocity 3700 ms shocks sample pressure approximately 14.5 GPa. Light emitted shocked sample collected fiber. This second geometry intended allow samples shocked various pressures near initiation threshold material. In configuration velocity flyer time impact sample measured using photonic Doppler velocimetry. Emitted light analyzed passing Princeton Instruments SP300i equipped 300 linesmm diffraction grating streak camera Hamamatsu C7700-01 set 1s sweep time. The spectrometerstreak camera combination provides overall resolution 0.6 nm per pixel. The streak spectrometry apparatus calibrated using mercury-argon lamp DAAAC software package Voss Scientific. The data corrected nonlinear wavelength dispersion nonlinear spectral intensity response system. A streak spectrum ultraviolet emission detonating HNAB film shown Figure 3. Williams Air Force Research Laboratory Munitions Directorate Eglin Air Force Base FL 32547 Abstract. The Air Force Research Laboratory Munitions Directorate developed sub-scale test aimed quantitatively compare reaction threshold different explosive fills low pressure 500 MPa long duration milliseconds loading events. In terms effort reaction threshold defined point burn deflagration reaction occurs. During initial development effort several test designs proposed design down-selected comparing test environment potential system standard set parameters. These included pressure fill duration pressure relative velocity explosive sample sliding within container. The outcome effort High Explosive Survivability Test HEST. Overall High Explosive Survivability Test offers unique simple safe robust approach quantitatively measure explosives reaction threshold respect long duration low pressure events. low pressure 500 MPa ever-increasing need understand reaction threshold energetic 72 ksi long duration ms events. Because highly desirable test quantitatively determine explosives ability survive events order aid future formulation development. It important note threshold referred point burn deflagration reaction occurs material intended detonation Current methods obtaining reaction threshold information include Expanded Large Scale Gap Test ELSGT 1 Intense Pressure Friction Test IPFT previously developed Air Force Research Laboratory Energetic Materials Branch 2 full-scale munition little data analysis testing. The ELSGT current testing standard several advantages. Namely easy operate provides quantitative measure explosive sensitivity based single variable thickness polymethyl-methacrylate PMMA submitted closely aligned desired environment. While required duration order milliseconds shock induced microseconds three orders magnitude short. Additionally pressures required less 500 MPa ELSGT input pressures closer 5000 MPa 725 ksi. The IPFT attempted solve issues creating test aimed closely mimic desired environment. However test plagued repeatability provide quantitative comparison Distribution A. Approved Public Release. Distribution Unlimited 96TW-2014-0033. thresholds different fills still struggled long durations required successfully model target environment. As largely discarded viable option testing. Finally option full-scale testing. While option provides advantage testing near-operational environment prohibitively expensive terms funding scheduling constraints use formulation screening tool. As AFRLRWME conducted effort create new sub-scale test designed fill gap. A summary currently available testing enumerated provided Table 1. Table 1. Current testing options Testing Constraints Objectives While main objective final test design properly mimic conditions desired several design constraints imposed development new test. This helped ensure test best able fulfill requirements developmental formulation effort. The main logistical constraint ability conduct test using local AFRL facilities. This helped test cost effective reduce amount time required schedule test series. In balance however desire keep sample size large possible effectively mimic conditions seen full-scale Furthermore desirable test could run several times day allowing used formulation screening tool experiment finalized formulations. It worth noting constraints designed intent help insert new test early formulation development process. By test open new material development need prohibitively expensive In terms testing capabilities test provide quantitative allowed direct comparison materials device able test materials failure another shortcoming IPFT thus giving insight margin survivability given material given condition. The concept margin allow formulators determine whether current materials meet given set future requirements new development effort required. Finally desirable construct test used GONOGO threshold metric similar ELSGT also aiding use screening option diagnostics. However also necessary test easily modifiable allow additional diagnostics later test iterations desired. Examples modifications presented later text. Daly K. Woirin christelle.colletherakles.com alban.combeherakles.com nicolas.dalyherakles.com HERAKLES SAFRAN Group Le Bouchet Research Centre karol.woirinherakles.com Abstract. Herakles Safran Group developed new types high explosives several years Le Bouchet research centre France. Currently Multiphase Blast eXplosives MBX investigated within scope two research projects. We shown experimentally introduction important mass content reactive particles e.g. aluminum increased significantly blast effects producing additional amount energy released expansion detonation products. This new family explosive compositions called Enhanced Blast We also shown recently use dense inert particles incorporated explosive formulations could lead much better control lethal area around target. Indeed Dense Inert Metal Explosives DIME produce increased impulse effect blast particles near field whereas effects dramatically decreased far Fully integrated projects development experimental facilities characterize new types explosives well new numerical models designed take account specific aspects multiphase detonation products behaviour. As consequence whole new methodology combining experiments calculations created better characterize predict effects delivered new families high explosives. This article deals experimental development study. Context Introduction constraints new war theatres efforts focused development new types weapons able generate specific effects enhanced blast effects low collateral damages For new types ammunitions new High Explosive HE compositions developed deliver desired effects. The aim enhance blast confined spaces enhance damage reduced area around explosion point associated strong decrease effects beyond limits area. temperature effects To obtain effects new high explosives developed containing high content metallic particles either aluminium tungsten. These high explosives commonly called Multiphase Blast eXplosives MBX detonation products contain gaseous phase solid phase. Aluminium particles known ability burn detonation process producing extra heat pressure effects. MBX contain aluminium particles ability produce pressure blast effects commonly called EBX Enhanced Blast The high density tungsten particles contributes convert part detonation energy kinetic energy able project fine dense inert particles. In particles generate strong impulse effects close hand due high density fall ground quickly projection lethal distance. These MBX also called DIME Dense Inert Metal Explosives. The early performance evaluation new explosive often limited available sample material. Dynamic evaluations generally require measurements detonation velocity pressure expansion energy. These experiments typically require large amounts material time expense often omitted replaced numerical estimates thermochemical codes. A FRICTION TEST FOR SIMULATING HIGH-PRESSURE INERTIAL Joshua Felts Harold Sandusky Naval Surface Warfare Center Indian Head Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technology Division Indian Head MD 20640 Abstract. Explosive fills penetrating warheads experience friction case walls fill compresses moves forward warhead impacts target. The standard friction tests used judging handling safety little confinement low sliding rates 3 ms much different conditions interest highvelocity warhead incur stresses order 100 MPa sliding velocities around 50 ms. This paper describes laboratory-scale test developed using 12.7-mm diameter samples subjected conditions initial tests seven explosives. Two explosive samples consisted insensitive energetic ingredient binder another contained HMX NTO aluminum Al remaining four included ammonium perchlorate AP. The explosives containing AP highest sensitivity whereas insensitive energetic ingredient able ignited. While relative rankings comparable small-scale safety test laboratory-scale test demonstrated inconsistencies occurring standard particle sizes AP uncured binder. Furthermore actual conditions known penetrating warhead method used screen candidate energetic fills survivability. Explosive fills sudden acceleration warhead penetration event compress within container slide relative container wall. Friction occurs explosive container wall often lined possibly within explosive adheres container liner. Following peak acceleration explosive fill rebounds slides along surfaces damaged may include dislodged explosive crystals. Until motion fully damped sliding process may repeat numerous times. Throughout process explosive fill confined subjected one surface either hard unlined container wall soft lined wall. If explosive adhered wall surface would similar soft wall explosives crystals lodged liner. The standard small-scale safety tests sliding friction judge sensitivity hand machine operations conditions little confinement low sliding rates relative conditions interest penetration event. The Alleghany Ballistics Laboratory ABL machine provides 445 kgf 980 lbf 51-mm diameter 3.2mm thick wheel hardened steel fixed rotating slides across sample hardened steel anvil discrete velocities either 0.91 ms 3 fts 2.44 ms 8 fts latter The smaller Bundesanstalt fr Materialprfung BAM machine capable applied load 36 kgf onto porcelain peg slides across porcelain anvil peak sliding velocity 0.074 ms. These machines pinch 35 45 mg sample hard surfaces one curved unknown pressures probably exceeding GPa without lateral confinement sample free extrude out. This pinching process crushing crystals different sliding explosive along case wall warhead penetration. There tests larger scale one friction surface dont replicate conditions penetrating warhead. Dyer Taylor1 apparatus pressed 25.4 mm cube explosive 0.69 50.3 MPa friction surface slides 10 ms constant velocity 1.5 6.0 ms. This test apparatus adapted Peterson et al2 use different explosives. Dickson et al.3 pressed 10-mm diameter sample 5.7 MPa disk rotating 2.5 15 ms. The skid test first mentioned reference 4 hemisphere 11.3 kg end pendulum contacts anvil usually 45. The Intense Pressure Friction Test IPFT4 attempts replicate conditions within penetration warhead 50.8-mm diameter 50.8mm long sample steel cylinder. Pistons placed end cylinder one receives input gun-launched projectile dampens transmitted motion pressurizes sample. At sliding velocities 50 ms radial pressure applied sample wall varied 960 MPa near input piston 130 MPa near output piston. Energetic nitramines important class military explosives propellants includes RDX HMX. Energetic materials used vast quantities 109 kgyr mining demolition operations relatively smaller quantities military uses small quantities used nuclear weapons improvised explosive devices. The accidental intentional initiation explosive propellant occurs critical quantity energy deposited critical volume material sufficient rate overcome heat losses. Sources heat include impact spark friction shock boundary heat e.g. fire. fundamental physical chemical processes allow us better control safety use ubiquitous materials. We understanding wide range materials common ignition stimuli accurate detailed physio-chemical understanding perhaps one energetic molecule HMX1-4 due widespread use. Years research revealed evidence four distinct reaction steps including solid state phase transition sublimation occurs quasi-melt phase.5 Significant data exist validate reaction mechanism conditions slow boundary heating.6 However little validation exists fast heating regimes 10-3 due difficulty making reliable temperature measurements short time scales presence large temperature gradients problem exists probing solid- liquid-state chemical reaction mechanism significant heat producing consuming steps. It goal provide reliable accurate data validate kinetics. We implemented microwave MW heating access time scale. The MW environment well controlled non-perturbing transport limited i.e. volumetric nature MW heating minimizes role thermal conduction ignition allows extremely high heating rates minimal temperature gradients short ignition times. Five copper cylinder tests performed insensitive explosive formulation PBX 9502. The tests spanned range sizes corresponding scales 0.25 0.50 2.00 relative conventional 25.4-mm-inner-diameter test. A separate work details product equation state derivation Experimental Details The experimental geometry consisted copper tube supported Delrin aluminum assem Introduction The detonation cylinder test standard high explosive performance diagnostic used derive detonation product equation-of-state information 12. Our cylinders 0.25- 0.50- 2.00-scaled designs conventional Approved unlimited release LA-UR-14-24823 Fig. 1. The cylinder test geometry. Table 1. Scaled cylinder test dimensions. Measurement tolerance 50 m. Standard test 25 mm ID dimensions included italics reference. bly shown Fig. 1. Cylinder tests commonly performed standardized scalable range dimensions xes ratio copper wall area explosive area across tube cross section detailed Table 1. In geometry ratio 0.440. Under constraint scaled variant expected yield identical wall velocity versus time data time axis normalized test scale assuming explosive energy yield invariant scale. When scale effects measured tests predominately elded 1.00 scale facilitate comparison historic data. That said larger reaction zones failure diameters associated non-ideal explosive may necessitate larger scales. Conversely researchers often eld smaller scales accommodate limited budgets explosive load limits test sites. The detonation supersonic relative sound speed copper tube drives shock wave wall. Upon initial shock breakout outer wall diameter discontinuously accelerates wall approximately 0.9 mms. Eventually product gas pressure longer exerts signicant force cylinder wall velocity approaches constant value V. For present experiments V approximately 1.5 mms. Small-Scale Tunnel Tests A sketch small-scale tunnel shown Figure 2. It steel tube 12.7-cm 5-in inner diameter 460-cm 15-ft length. The diameter sample size chosen limit mixing reactive detonation products air. For sample 4.5 grams aluminum 5.2 tunnel diameters 66 cm required combust aluminum. A length-to-diameter ratio least one desired sample. For sample diameter 1.91-cm 0.75 length 10-g sample varied 1.91 2.54 cm 0.75 1.0-in depending density. The steel charge holder provided confinement around charge wall thickness 2.86-cm 1.125-in. This high confinement allowed detonation samples critical diameters 1.91-cm 0.75 in. The holders conical booster 2-grams RDX based plastic bonded explosive PBX initiated RP-80 detonator. The charge holder bolted back source section. Rubber sheeting wrapped around outer diameter charge holder form 1.91-cm 0.75-in thick buffer holder inside surface source section. This rubber Fig. 2 Sketch Small-Scale Tunnel wrap served two purposes lessen damage fragments source section minimize shock input steel wall. The source section assembly bolted onto end tunnel plastic ring tunnel. The plastic ring dampened shock tunnel aided keeping rubber wrap exiting source section fragments charge holder. The charge holder typically broke four large pieces became lodged rubber along number much smaller pieces. The end tunnel remained open. A Comparison Wavelet Quadrature Peak-to-Peak Methods Determining Shock Velocity Microwave Interferometer Data David E. Kittell Jesus O. Mares Steven F. Son1 1Purdue University West Lafayette IN USA Microwave interferometry MI used measure shock detonation velocities explosives. To achieve greater spatial resolution modern systems employ quadrature mixer continuously measure phase advancement output signal time. However quadrature analysis difficult implement data low signal noise ratio variable amplitude harmonic frequencies. In work continuous wavelet transform CWT based Gabor mother wavelet used analyze velocity data. The wavelet-based method compared previous techniques quadrature peak-to-peak analysis using real manufactured data small-scale explosives characterization experiment. Results show wavelet-based analysis multiple advantages peak-to-peak quadrature including greater robustness handling signal noise increased velocity-time resolution single tunable parameter may optimized different types signals. In addition wavelet-based technique used show effect density variations explosive triaminotrinitrobenzene TATB. This technique also potential distinguish multiple independent frequencies considered study decoupling shock reaction zones. Overall wavelet-based technique suggested improved addition analysis tools used field explosives research particular microwave interferometry. This analysis approach could also applied experimental data. Microwave interferometry MI measure shock detonation velocities explosives. This technique used measure phase amplitude microwave signals transmitted unreacted explosive reflected back locations interest. These reflection points located dielectric discontinuities shock wave reaction front occur media detonation event12. The phase measurements used infer relative position velocity phenomena. While established peak-to-peak quadrature methods often adequate tracking location moving strong reflector shock detonation wave instantaneous velocity challenging due inherent numerical errors associated methods. A new approach exploits proportionality velocity reflector relative phase change signal use time-frequency analysis. This would suggest consideration continuous wavelet transform CWT due greater flexibility optimizing time-frequency resolution short-time Fourier transform STFT alternative3. Wavelet analysis applied photonic Doppler velocimetry PDV45 optical techniques velocity interferometer system reflector VISAR6. For applications CWT shown advantageous measuring shock velocity4-6. In work new data analysis technique proposed directly measure velocity detonation event using different CWT based method. The proposed technique compared currently established procedures processing manufactured data known frequency-time content effective error evaluated method. Select examples real data small scale explosives test processed using method results directly compared evaluation. This method suggested improved addition analysis tools used field microwave interferometry possibly similar data. Experimental Methods A 35 GHz signal generated using transmitted test article solid 0.635 cm diameter Teflon waveguide. A quadrature mixer used produce two-channel output 90 degrees phase recorded 2.5 GHz using Tektronix DPO4034 Digital Phosphor Oscilloscope. Timing experiment based first light observed fiber optics M34L02 Thorlab patch cable 600 core diameter photodetector 1 ns rise time. The detonation contained inside thick-walled steel box schematic experiment shown Fig. 1. In study two types explosives pressed 0.651 cm I.D. 304 stainless steel velocity measurement Kinepak ammonium nitrate mixed fuel oil ANFO triaminotrinitrobenzene TATB powder. In quest reactive materials besides aluminum may hold promise rapid energy release one material magnesium-boron composite powder. In study formulations based PBX 9501 produced 15 HMX replaced reactive aluminum powder magnesium-boron composite powder inert surrogate LiF. Optically Measuring Invisible Explosive Impulse Matthew M. Biss Kevin L. McNesby Lethality Divisions Energetic Technology Branch U.S. Army Research Laboratory APG MD 21005 Abstract. An experimental technique investigated optically measure explosive impulse produced detonating spherical laboratory-scale charges air. Explosive impulse historically calculated integration temporal pressure histories obtained via piezoelectric pressure transducers. The presented technique instead combines schlieren flow visualization high-speed digital imaging optically measure explosive impulse numerous radial locations limited sensor resolution recording rates. Prior explosive event schlieren system calibration performed via calibrated light-ray refractions resulting digital image intensities. Laboratory-scale energetic-material charges detonated test section schlieren system imaged using high-speed digital camera. Image intensities downstream shock wave translated temporal density profile subsequently converted pressure-versus-time profile. Through integration profile positive pressure duration explosive impulse determined given radial location. fielding munition energetic potentialperformance target. Performance characterized experimental measurement detonation- blast-wave properties produced air. The detonation properties interest i.e. pressure velocity particle velocity density depend upon chemical composition energetic material vary pressing density. The detonation wave upon reaching energetic materialair interface transferred surrounding air radially outward propagating blast wave. The outward propagating blast wave transports mechanical energy damage potential produced material. Thus radial measurements blast wave peak pressure explosive impulse gathered performance characterization. Ideal explosive pressure trace. blast-wave measurements traditionally gathered full-scale kilogramrange charges masses ranging 1-105 kg.2 Explosive scaling laws later applied experimental results comparison charge masses. Experiments measure shock waves temporal pressure history fixed radialstandoff positions using piezoelectric pressure transducers. Being mechanically actuated transducers possess characteristic finite response time inhibits ability accurately respond discontinuous signal shock wave.3-6 To easily manage data multiple empirical smoothing curves developed previous authors.1 However need empirically based curves increases error measurement. Recently laboratory-based researchers extended explosive scaling laws validity peak shock wave pressure kilogram-range charges gram even milligram research optical flow shadowgraph etc. combined high-speed digital cameras track radial shock wave propagation rate permitting continuous radially varying peak shock wave pressure profile equation. This extension laboratory scale demonstrated highly traditional air-blast experiments provides non-intrusive continuous profile compared intrusive point measurements obtained Rankine-Hugoniot pressure transducer histories laboratory full scale optical characterization method explored. A Spectrally Encoded Imaging Diagnostic Shock Detonation Physics Experiments Los Alamos National Laboratory Los Alamos New Mexico USA Abstract. A novel diagnostic based spectrally encoded imaging SEI developed shock detonation physics experiments. Depending conguration system diagnostic capable collecting surface breakout data analogous streak framing camera systems. The diagnostic also several key features enable measurements beyond traditional camera systems. Firstly information collected shot transmitted entirely single optical ber. Thus full optical access shot required. As result system elded remote contained facilities gas guns within fully enclosed experimental assemblies. Secondly system non-imaging traditional optics sense. Surface breakout information collected target surfaces shape geometry unlike traditional optical systems must contend optical depth-of-eld issues. As result potential applications new SEI diagnostic endless. A novel chromatism-based surface diagnostic developed supplant replace several conventional high speed imaging diagnostics including streak framing cameras. The goal devise simple ber-based system acquire equivalent imaging data spatial target conguration. Such diagnostic widespread use shock detonation physics experiments surface breakout measurements required. Applications include detonation performance testing measure front curvature detonation velocity inert shock wave experiments. Essentially measurement relies tracking shock wave breakout along material interface possible optical probe-based system developed. Traditional measurements features required use specialized streak framing cameras gold standard. Typically lm-based systems preferred since performance respect resolution dynamic range image distortion still superior digital camera despite recent advances. Unfortunately high speed instrumentation lm cameras produced less frequently remaining manufacturers Kodak becoming exceedingly hard acquire. In general lm must purchased bulk quantities order persuade given manufacturer dedicated production run. Recently last remaining manufacturers beginning deny even limited runs eventually supply instrumentation lm disappear imaging technology fully transitions strictly digital recording. As long amount light target location collected image surface determined described below. The SEI diagnostic system easy construct replicate shares many components typical PDV system. As result easy process modify existing PDV system add SEI capability. Luckily high speed digitizers already exist facilities modern detonation performance capabilities. The remaining components fairly inexpensive ber optics. Because chosen system bandwidth system tested corresponds telecommunications C-band wide variety ber optics equipment optimized band available including optical ampliers miscellaneous ber opticSWIFT Explosive PIV W-6 Detonator Technology Los Alamos National Laboratory Los Alamos NM 87545 USA Abstract. The shock wave image framing technique SWIFT explosive particle image velocimetry PIV diagnostics utilize ultra-high-speed imaging directly visualize explosively-driven motion condensed transparent materials. Implementation simultaneous SWIFT explosive PIV diagnostic currently development quantitatively characterize output explosive devices measuring shock material mass motion instants time. The current state development SWIFT diagnostic well ongoing implementation explosive PIV presented. The shock wave image framing technique SWIFT mature diagnostic Detonator Technology group Los Alamos National Laboratory investigating performance explosive devices. SWIFT employs spoiled-coherence laser backlighting coupled schlieren optics observe temporal spatial evolution shock waves resulting detonation events conned within transparent media. General system design implementation presented previously1 current modes operation include sub-millimeter-scale initiator components millimeter-scale detonator components centimeter-scale high-expl osive HE trains. The ability directly visualize explosive output using ultra-high-speed frame rates allows evolution two-dimensional 2-D shock-front geometries characterized 2-D shock position displacement velocity histories Explosive particle image velocimetry PIV development complement SWIFT tracking Lagrangian motion small tracer particles propagate mass-velocity eld moving behind detonation-induced shock waves transparent materials. Results initial experiments demonstrate need dynamic two-dimensional correction applied experimental data order correct optical distortions arise viewing ow-tracing particles curved shock waves2. Implementation simultaneous SWIFT explosive PIV diagnostic currently underway utilize high accuracy reproducibility SWIFT data order develop appropriate optical corrections corresponding PIV data. The goal current research develop diagnostic capable simultaneously measuring temporal evolution shock corresponding mass motion two dimensions. Recent SWIFT data presented demonstrate versatility technique range spatial scales current designs simultaneous SWIFTexplosive PIV diagnostic discussed emphasis two-dimensional corrections Fig. 1. J. Burns M Goff C Stennett A Roberts AWE PLC Reading Aldermaston RG4 7PR Cranfield University Shrivenham Swindon SN6 8LA Abstract. An array permanent magnets designed used embedded particle velocity gauge technique used shock initiation gas gun experiments polymer bonded explosives PBXs. The array consists six permanent magnets along two field shaping mild steel components maximize field strength maintaining optimum field homogeneity. A magnetic field strength 189.6 0.3 mT achieved standard deviation 0.07 across particle velocity gauge elements. The array successfully tested inert explosive targets. For many years run detonation high explosives studied using single twostage gas guns123. Various different regimes studied including sustained pulse thin pulse double shocks. The gas gun used rapidly accelerate flier generally well characterised material desired velocity. The projectile impacts target material study case PBX. Particle Velocity Gauge Technique The particle velocity gauge technique uses Faradays Law magnetic induction states wire length l moving though magnetic 2 coils equal radius R . Typical Helmholtz coils used plate impact experiments produce field strengths 70 120 mT. While field shape relatively flat variation field strength order 2 distance 10 mm midpoint. The use permanent magnets explored order enhance field terms strength homogeneity. Recent developments resulted considerable increase field strength solid state permanent magnets. The Cheetah chemical equilibration code capability determine chemical species andor concentrations may changing second shock regime. One possibility state solid carbon products. Jackson Materials Physics Applications Division Los Alamos National Laboratory Los Alamos NM 87545 Weapons Experiments Division Los Alamos National Laboratory Los Alamos NM 87545 Abstract. Measuring detonation front position velocity demonstrated using all-optical chirped fiber Bragg grating CFBG approach ability detect velocity changes across material interfacial boundaries. Our light source amplified spontaneous emission ASE source covering C-band 1525 nm 1565 nm. Light launched ASE source single-mode fiber directed 3-port circulator. The circulator directs light chirped fiber Bragg grating CFBG sensor. The CFBG linearly chirped grating written along length fiber maximum reflectivity C-band. Reflected light return circulator detector. A variable attenuator controlled optical power gratings saturate detectors. All CFBG grating directed channels came integrated two four-channel chassis boxes Timbercon Inc. Each channel inside chassis box contained 10 power tap monitoring spectrum returning light CFBG DC-coupled 50-Ohm output 250-MHz InGaAs photodetector. The detectors yield total temporal resolution limit 4 ns. The signal 10 tap sent fiber-based 512-element linear diode array spectrometer characterize spectrum grating detonation. The CFBGs send light return power typically 1 mW 0.0 dBm chassis box outputs electrical signal transient digitizer oscilloscope. The recording bandwidth 1 GHz sampling rate 5 GSamps. Achieving direct optimal optical controlled initiation condensed phase systems entails utilizing specific time dependent electric fields guide energy flow along desired reaction coordinate pathway. A preliminary step toward understanding controlling energetic materials deciphering photochemical dynamics transpire time dependent electric fields interact energetic materials. To illuminate path towards controlled energetic material photodecomposition investigated excitation nitromethane perdeuterated nitromethane recently developed simultaneous transient absorption excited state femtosecond stimulated Raman spectroscopy techniques. The ability simultaneously measure dynamic absorption vibrational response due photoexcitation elucidated electric field interaction associated photochemical dynamics nitromethane. Our experiments suggest nitromethane shows fast 1 picosecond product formation possibly methyl nitrite excitation 266 nm 150fs pulse. Current optical initiation methods used detonators energetic materials non-direct.1 They utilize titanium coating optical fiber create plasma starts initiation thermal deflagration detonation process. Optimal control optical initiation allows direct absorption laser light energetic material. Using control mechanisms localize energy deposition photochemical dynamics transpire time dependent electric fields interact material. Achieving controlled photodynamics requires femtosecond laser pulse guide energy flow along excited state following desired reaction coordinate pathway.23 Realizing direct optical controlled initiation condensed phase systems necessitates propagation exothermic photochemistry chemical reactions autocatalyze grow initiation. Understanding chemistry occurs reaction front explosive detonation extremely difficult due short time-scale violent release energy form heat sound light blast. In addition full-scale detonation testing quite expensive. The ability study chemical reactions properties explosives small-scale laboratory environment would greatly benefit development improved explosive formulations. The feasibility exploiting laser-induced plasma chemistry study chemical reactions metallic nanoparticles molecular explosives cyclotrimethylene trinitramine RDX demonstrated. Using method confirmed presence aluminum RDX-based explosion results increased amount unreacted carbon. In addition shock wave generated air laser-induced plasma used predict explosive properties ablated material i.e. energetic materials generate faster laser-induced shock velocities non-energetic materials. mechanisms combustion thermal explosion detonation essential order develop efficient explosives propellants. In addition chemical products produced performance understanding chemical reactions involved decomposition component mixtures crucial. In recent study Song et al. investigated formation C aluminized-cyclotrimethylene trinitramine RDX shock tube explosion.1 Both unreacted carbon C C2 AlO decrease rocket performance. By monitoring C2 AlO emission observed increasing quantity micron-sized Al particles added RDX subsequently studied effect nano-aluminum experimental setup.2 detonation RDX increased C2 emission. Here demonstrate alternate approach studying chemical reactions molecular explosives metallic nanoparticles. laser-induced breakdown approach based involves generating metallic nanoparticles via laser ablation studying chemical reactions occur laser-induced plasma monitoring timeresolved emission spectra. LIBS analytical technique widely investigated past several decades qualitative quantitative material applications include detection explosives.4 It recently groups started investigating chemical reactions involving explosive materials occur lifetime laser-induced plasma tens hundreds microseconds subsequent effect In work laser ablation thin film residues RDX various metal substrates generating nanoenergetic particles combined observation time-resolved resulting hightemperature plasma. The relative concentrations C C2 CN H N O well metal substrate-related atomic molecular ionic species emitting 200-940 nm tracked lifetime plasma typically 1 ms. Several experiments designed understand time-dependence species formation plasma determine effect metals chemistry RDX performed. providing method characterizing high-temperature chemistry energetic material formulations laser-induced plasma results generation shock wave propagates background gas. Thermal converted kinetic energy resulting high expansion velocities. The expansion high pressure vapor acts piston driving surrounding atmosphere compressing ambient gas front thin shell. For laser ablation force piston depends volume gas produced related ablated mass temperature reached plasma plume. Energy transferred surrounding air combination thermal conduction radiative transfer heating resulting shock wave. At high laser irradiances shock heating dominates.8 The laser-induced shock wave similar detonation phenomenon called blast wave.9-11 The presence various contact fronts ionization front main external shock front confirmed shadowgraph imaging e.g. Callies et al.12 In second study measured shock wave velocity generated large variety inert energetic materials order effect exothermic chemical reactions laser-induced shock wave. The ultimate goal research develop laboratory-scale method estimating detonation performance using milligram quantities energetic materials. Kleine et al. verified blast wave scaling laws confirmed detonation tests ranging 1-109 grams also apply charges milligram range.13 Large-scale testing hundreds millions grams explosive expensive timeconsuming addition diagnostics difficult inherently destructive nature tests opaqueness early fireball. In many cases scaling production new types energetic materials prohibitively expensive without priori assurance performance gains conventional explosives. The ideal small-scale test require scale-up formulation potential new energetic materials could safely performed laboratory environment minimal cost per test. Shot 4829 showed detonation pressures 6 gauges indicating 0.52 GPa input pressure completely desensitize Ignition Growth Desensitization Model The Ignition Growth reactive flow model shock initiation detonation used understand many shock initiation detonation studies solid explosives propellants several 1D 2D 3D codes 6. The set Ignition Growth parameters detonating LX-17 established modeling many 1D 2D 3D experiments. The model uses two Jones-Wilkins-Lee JWL equations state one unreacted explosive one reaction products temperature dependent form V CvTV 1 p pressure megabars V relative volume T temperature measured Gruneisen coefficient Cv average heat capacity A B R1 R2 constants. The reaction product JWL equation state fit wall velocity expansion data cylinder tests laser interferometric plate push data steady overdriven detonations 9. The three-term rate law describes three stages reaction generally observed shock initiation detonation explosive detonation modeling first term Equation 2 represents explosive compressed leading 3D shock wave creating hot regions triple shock interactions 10. The fraction explosive ignited assumed equal void volume pressed explosive reacted less nanosecond. For LX-17 1.905 gcm3 initial void volume 2. The second reaction rate Eq. 4 models rapid formation major reaction product gases CO2 N2 H2O CO etc. highly vibrationally excited states subsequent expansion equilibration 10. This process LX-17 measured take approximately 80 nanoseconds techniques 1112. The third term Eq. 4 used describe relatively slow diffusion controlled formation nanometer size solid carbon particles diamond graphite amorphous carbon single small groups carbon atoms. For LX-17 last 20 chemical energy release assumed due solid graphite nanoparticle formation diffusion controlled process. Determining explosive equivalence remains complex problem function effect interest. The metric interest present work blast damage thin aluminum plate. The effect different pressing conditions including hot isostatic pressing hot molding pressing cold molding pressing tensile properties PBXs discussed based experimental results. The influence loading rate strength fracture toughness PBXs analyzed. The results show methods adopted experiments effective measure dynamic tensile property PBXs. The dynamic tensile strength fracture toughness show obvious loading-rate dependence. Polymer-bonded explosive PBX highly particle-filled composite comprised 90-95 weight explosive crystals held together polymeric binder 5-10 weight. In general tensile strength PBXs much lower compressive strength tensile failure important failure mode PBXs. The study tensile properties tensile failure drawn continuous attention among explosive researchers. Low tensile strength MPa high brittleness explosives make direct test difficult using conventional dumbbell specimen especially dynamic Email pwchenbit.edu.cn One suitable tests brittle materials Brazilian test indirect tensile test. Brazilian test disc sample loaded diametrically compression used determine tensile failure stress brittle materials.1 In past two decades application Brazilian test PBX simulants undertaken many authors. Palmer et al studied distribution stress failure strength fracture behavior PBX different compositions.2 Combining scanning electrical microscope SEM atomic force microscope AFM optical techniques e.g. moir interferometry3 4and digital image correlation5-7 mechanical behavior failure mechanism PBX measured studied. However considered difficulty preparation brittle material samples new sample geometries test method proposed. Several modified Brazilian test including FDB test SCB test used determine tensile fracture toughness brittle materials.8-10 Chen et al studied tensile failure stress PBX quasistatic Brazilian test.11 The results show tensile mechanical influenced pressing pressures temperatures. PBXs behave quite differently high strain rates compared quasi-static cases. Increasing strain rate strongly affects mechanical response PBXs. Grantham et al carried dynamic Brazilian test SHPB study dynamic mechanical properties PBX9501.12 The tensile strains tensile stress strain curves obtained using optical technique. In paper method combining SHPB high-speed DIC technique developed study dynamic tensile behavior PBX simulants. Various tensile test including Brazilian disc test BDT flattened Brazilian disc FBD test semi-circular bend SCB test used measure dynamic tensile strength fracture toughness. A highly accurate numerical shock-tting scheme composed fth order spatial third order temporal discretizations applied two-dimensional reactive Euler equations several models single-step irreversible kinetics slab geometry. The chemical reaction zone CRZ describes spatial temporal region behind detonation front explosive reactants converted products exothermic decomposition reactions flow subsonic. The CRZ characteristic explosives chemical composition decomposition reaction rates vary 10s ns e.g. conventional high explosives behind front smm non-ideal formulations e.g. ammonium nitrate-fuel oil. The CRZ often measured using optical velocimetry techniques windowed interface window affects reaction zone dynamics due wave interactions interface. Sulimov Institut PPRIME P UPR 3346 CNRS Departement Fluide-Thermique-Combustion ENSMA 86961 Semenov Institute Chemical Physics RAN 119991 Moscow - Russia Futuroscope-Chasseneuil France Abstract. Dry mixture Ammonium Nitrate AN Sodium Dichloroisocyanurate DCCNa SDIC chemically stable normal temperature. However local moistening mixture triggers chemical reactions release gaseous nitrogen trichloride N Cl3 highly unstable explosive product. Convection condensation gas dry part AN-DCCNa mixture adjacent moistened one makes zone extremely sensitive. Provoked self-ignition zone always results fast transition detonation. This paper provides phenomenological description explosion mechanism. Moistened AN-DCCNa mixture extremely dangerous behavior unpredictable. A strong recommendation AN DCCNa never cross. Dichloroisocyanurate chemically stable components normal conditions. Their mixture becomes unstable water locally injected. Contact chlorines ammonium salts known1 produce nitrogen trichloride N Cl3 sensitive explosive molecule.2 This molecule detected3 among gaseous products AN-DCCNa mixtures reaction UV spectroscopy FTIR Fourier Transform Infrared Spectrometer Contamination AN DCCNa one likely causes explosion AN storage warehouse inside AZF plant Toulouse - September 21st 2001. The explosion 300-400 tons downgraded off-specs fertilizer technical grade AN killed 31 people injured several thousand people damaged 30000 houses. Preliminary experiments shown addition small quantity water 5050 AN-DCCNa mixture results - exothermic chemical reaction starts immediately moistened part mixture - increase local temperature inside reaction zone 100oC - production explosive gas convects outside reaction zone. A hot wire electric igniter localized centimeters small pile moistened mixture provokes explosion gas diluted surrounding air - spontaneous explosion without pyrotechnic device hot wire. Time water injection spontaneous explosion last tenths seconds tenths minutes. The goal paper experimentally de 407 Fig. 1. Quirk Los Alamos National Laboratory Los Alamos NM 87545 Abstract. A study presented oblique interaction step shock unreacted explosive resolved reaction zone detonation rigid wedge. Two condensedphase detonation models considered 1 polytropic EOS model Aslam-BdzilStewart ABS 2 simple JWL EOS-based model Ignition Growth IG. The model calibrated give measured detonation speed appropriate EOS A Robust 3-Component Reactive-Flow Model using JWL Equations State Here describe 3-component reactive-flow model used model detonation blast explosives. We assume explosive Three components reactant intermediate Three EOSs one component based P-V-T form JWL EOS Two reaction rates. The 3 components consist 1 fullyunreacted phase referred component-1 consisting unreacted high explosive binder aluminum 2 partially-reacted phase referred component-2 consisting explosive binder unreacted aluminum 3 fully-reacted phase referred component3 aluminum also undergone reaction. A standard continuum mixture hypothesis assumes 3-components phases phase separated interaction energy phases geometric dimensions unreacted HMX aluminum etc. particles small material considered well-mixed materials. Implementation Testing 3Component JWL EOS Reactive-Flow Model. Since hydrocodes ALE3D CTH model 3-component detonation models used UIUC 1D3D Euler solver AH-AXS1D3D solve described partial-differential equations. Our solver uses uniform structured grid method lines 3rd-order accurate TVD Runge-Kutta scheme time advancement. The spatial solver uses WENO5-LLF uses component wise Local Lax-Friedrich LLF flux splitting scheme 5th-order accurate WENO interpolation. AH-AXS1D3D verified convergence accuracy running fourteen relevant 1D2D3D test cases using Ideal EOS 3-component JWL EOS form. The results resolution-study agreement results found published papers showed accurate stable performance metrics. We tested implementation 3-component JWL reactive flow model AH-AXS1D3D comparing steady traveling wave detonation solution model AH-AXS1D3D solution. Analysis Equation State Initiation Model TATB-based LX-17 Seth Root Leah Tuttle Sandia National Laboratories Albuquerque 87125 Abstract. The unreacted equation state EOS energetic materials determined using standard shock shockless compression experimental methods. For detonation products EOS typically determined cylinder expansion tests sideways plate push test. The difculty experiments metal acceleration one-dimensional problem. The tests also require use initiation model requires analysis well. In work perform series plate-impact experiments examine initiation model detonation product EOS TATB-based explosive LX-17. The LX-17 samples backed various thicknesses well-characterized metal buffers Al Cu Ta velocity interferometry measures velocity proles metalLiF window interface. The experimentally measured velocity proles compared simulations determine effectiveness models optimization methods used suggest improvements models. The equation state EOS energetic materials important understanding performance safety plastic-bonded explosive PBX. The unreacted EOS PBX determined shock compression Hugoniot measurements1 shockless compression techniques using Sandias VELOCE Z-Machine2. Determining EOS detonation products difcult task. Principal methods used determine product EOS cylinder expansion test3 sideways plate push test4. These experiments inherently multi-dimensional problems may introduce complications analysis. In 1940s Goranson performed one-dimensional experiments using plane-wave generator initiate explosive interest5. The explosive backed metal plate various thickness free surface velocity metal plate measured using contact pins. Plotting free surface velocity versus metal plate thickness Goranson able examine reaction zone width detonation product EOS. Recently Vandersall et al. used double shock conguration examine reacted EOS LX17.6 In experiments authors found JWL EOS Ignition Growth model able reasonable reproduce double shock behavior lack fast kinetics models could obtain ideal matches experiments. In work use modied version Goranson metal plate acceleration experiment test initiation model detonation product EOS LX-17. LX-17 triaminotrinitrobenzene TATB based explosive nominally 7.5 binder weight. TATB-based explosives interest extreme insensitivity impact. LX-17 studied several con 485 ditions several models exist detonation products. We examined potential EOS models unreacted reacted LX-17 well initiation model using CTH simulations comparing experimental results. Optimization methods used modify model behavior match experimental data. Hill Tariq D. Aslam Los Alamos National Laboratory Los Alamos NM 87545 USA Abstract. This paper examines effect conning materials detonation propagation high-density solid explosives. We rst discuss physical origins connement distinguish detonation wave product connement. Next present ideal connement theory called shock polar analysis three essential casesstrong weak stiffwhich represent Tantalum Ta Sylgard Sy rubber Aluminum Al conners respectively PBX 9502 explosive. We discuss polar analysis breaks real devices. Next present carefully conceived experiments example materials PBX 9502 conned Ta Sy Al compare results shock polar predictions. Finally present experimental results thin Sy layer backed thick Ta Al thin Silicone foam layer backed thick stainless steel. Both thick weak-layers thin weak-layers backed strong stiff layers propagated unconned. Introduction Detonation Connement The Velocity Detonation VOD High Explosive HE charge generally expected increase encased conning material. That said many charges large enough detonation propagates nearly Chapman-Jouguet CJ speed even bare. strong connement barely increases VOD. For example 1-inch-dia. HMX-based bare rate stick propagates nearly CJ speed. Consequently VOD hardly affected conning thick copper Cu tube used standard Cylinder Expansion CYLEX test. bare 1-inch-dia. PBX 9502 95 wt TATB 5 wt binder charge detonates 7.6 mms whereas estimated CJ VOD 7.8 mms. Here margin one would expect corresponding CYLEX VOD lie two values. In reality although lot effects fully sorted 9502 CYLEX VOD higher remains 7.6 mms. Thus real connement effects complex non-intuitive. We discuss reasons present experimental data several important carefully controlled conned PBX 9502 congurations. Physical Origins Detonation Wave Connement Distinction Product Connement Figure 1 shows schematic drawing CYLEX test emphasis placed upon wave structure. The reference frame shock-xed materials ow left right. The detonation shock drives oblique shock tube wall deects material interface outward. This compliance constitutes connement loss relative rigid boundary would unyielding. The oblique shock reects tube free-surface expansion wave structure continues reverberate tube wall alternating sign diminishing effect. Fig. 1. Schematic CYLEX test wave-xed coordinates emphasizing wave structure illuminating origins detonation connement. Downstream detonation shock within reaction zone lies sonic surface ahead ow inuences drives detonation shock behind not. The material interface deection alters ow pattern shock sonic surface turn affects shock shape VOD. The material interface deection lies values corresponding two physical limits innite connement i.e. rigid wall one end zero connement other. The unconned limit correspond bare charges vacuum one might suppose instead shall see may occur variety relatively insubstantial materials include air foams plastics rubbers. This zero detonation connement actually occurs response conner causes sonic surface meet detonation shock charge edge. However condition achieved effect isolate shock lateral downstream surroundings thus causing propagate shape VOD charge bare surroundings evacuated. If head rst expansion wave returning tube free-surface intersects material interface downstream point sonic surface meets latter drawn Fig. 1 detonation shock inuenced freesurface. Consequently effect detonation wall thickness innite. There exists critical conning-layer thickness two features meet material inter face axial location. For smaller layer thicknesses connement effect decreases layer thickness decreases vanishing latter approaches zero. Thin-wall behavior probably intuitive thick-wall behavior qualitatively like familiar detonation product Whereas detonation wave connement affects detonation propagation detonation product connement constrains lateral product expansion. This effect operates much larger times distances purely one mass loading. Consequently depend wall density thickness alone product two. More specically Gurney analysis tells us product connement depends conner-to-HE-mass ratio. Detonation Wave Connement DSD Model Detonation Shock Dynamics DSD hierarchical approximation reactive Euler equations used propagate curved detonation waves 1. The simplest widely-implemented variant propagates waves single mathematical functioncalled intrinsic relationwhich relates local normal component detonation speed Dn local total curvature . DSD theory goes far reveal functional dependence quasiunique Dn expression. Its mathematical shape must discovered experimentally. Besides calibrated Dn curve considered HE DSD generally needs angle boundarycondition BC charge edge. The exception angle edge emerging wave less sonic angle value occurs edge bare rate stick. For supersonic BCs emerging wave sense presence charge edge propagates charge continued indenitely. Supersonic BCs commonly occur congurations detonation rst-breakout tangential point charge surface. cases angle wave edge zero rst emergence generally increases intersection point propagates outward. At point reaches would seek increase beyond detonation senses charge edge quickly establishes value c consistent connement condition c 90. We noted many nominally-conned scenarios actually propagate unconned c s. Even conned scenarios still ags timeplace supersonic BC lost conner rst sensed. This important sub-problem considered solved PBX 9502 previously measured fronts-value two rather different methods curvature rate stick 3 failure cone 4. Both yielded s-values see Figs. 1 2 35. Model Connement-Prescriptions RBM vs DSD Reactive Burn Models RBMs simulate connement effects directly computing details like rendered Fig. 1. This method pros cons. The main advantage automation one enters best-known material properties HE conner pops result. For example layer thickness less critical value consequences directly simulated. No connement calibration necessary RBMs able directly incorporate them. A disadvantage RBMs one may computing power spatially resolve thin conning layers much less generate interior physical details see Fig. 1 inuence connement. A prediction made may realistic. Another RBM shortfall real-world connement affected subtler phenomena like air foam rubber gapswhich RBMs generally cannot resolveand viscosity heat conduction HE granularitywhich RBMs treat. Because DSD model simpler RBM models connement prescription must invoke direct experimental calibration. By naturally incorporates multiple real-world connement effectswhich may understood even necessarily identiedin way RBMs cannot. Thus DSD much computationally efcient RBM models also accurate problems. From point forward shall consider DSDlevel detonation wave connement matter complex conner structure simply quantied c-value associated HEconner pair. We shall rst consider theory experiments single-conning-layers supercritical thickness present experiments complex double-layer scenarios. The simplest theoretical construct shock polar analysis introduced gasdynamics Busemann 1931 5. Though details murky likely rst adapted HE von Neumann connection HE lensing contributions Manhattan project 6. Then 1966 Sternberg Piacesi 7 rst applied polar analysis conned HE slab PentoliteIron assuming polytropic equation state EOS. We outline concepts assumptions. Causality ensures two shocks meet material interface. The HE cannot react instantly virtually inert neighborhood node point two shocks material interface meet. Material strength much smaller pressure imparted detonation thus deviatoric stresses neglected. Both materials assumed possess Up-Us Hugoniot. Under assumptions one may derive parametric pressureshock-deection-type polar curve material relates ow pressure P streamline deection angle . Its form unimportant present discussion given 10. The two materials assumed intimate contact must both. And material strength negligible materials behave uids material interface cannot support stress differential. Hence P materials neighborhood interface. These dual physical requirements simultaneously satised P curves two materials cross. For reason gasdynamic parlance calls P - space match plane. As DSD requires relevant data conned detonation experiments. Real-World Effects Detonation Connement Shock polar theory assumes material layers assembly ideal. Because never true real devices appreciation non-ideal effects essential design effective detonation connement experiments. Next discuss two general causes connement non-ideality. Gaps Between HE Conner Liquids cast-cure granular HEs generally poured containerconner. Because uid gap discounting possible cast-cure shrinkage forms HE container. Likewise putty-like HE materials may packed container without gaps. For solid explosive pieces however gaps generally exist HE intended wave conner. For example HE cylinders red tube insertion tolerance necessary keep charges binding. For standard 1-in-dia. CYLEX test nominal tolerance-gap 1 In scenarios insertion toler13 m. ances far generous. Even slab congurations gaps usual situation surfaces extremely uniformly loaded. Although O10 gap seems diminutive comparable PBX 9501 95 wt HMX 5 wt binder CJ reaction zone thickness CJ 25 13. From Fig. 1 associated discussion substantial isolation detonation conner expected cases. For PBX 9502 however CJ O1000 m. By CJ measuring-stick argument one would expect O10 air gap compromise connement yet noted 1 negligible effect realized CYLEX. The likely reason fact 9502 HMX-like reaction-zone component e.g. WSD model 14 CJ half-reaction thickness 30 followed long tail. The fast component may control wave connement. There another possible explanation. Detonation products jet ahead even narrow gaps 15 gasses might pre-shock deaden insensitive TATB-based HE near charge edge. Reaction quenching even retardation edge layer would slow detonation. It conceivable connement jetting effects virtually cancel 9502 CYLEX tests. Material Non-Ideality Most PBX formulations composed crystalline HE grains interspersed binder machined surface roughness comparable If detonation reaction substantially homogeneous PBX 9501 conned scenarios 13 grain size exceed CJwhich 9501 4. Thus machined surface roughness causes OCJ RMS gap thickness. In contrast insensitive PBX 9502 reacts quite heterogeneously 16 meaning reaction spreads hottest regions consume interstitial material. Because hot spot locations tied heterogeneous HE microstructure one argues CJ unlikely sub-grain-scaleas indeed full 9502 reaction zone not. Consequently surface roughnesses well-machined 9502 parts much smaller CJ. If excellent conner contact achieved hotspot criticality might altered high thermal conductivity conner. Like product-jet deadening effect would quench retard reaction HE edge layer thickness would On13 n supercritical hot spot number density n13 tied microstructure. Experimental Details The Detonation-Connement Sandwich Test Consistent contact solid HE various conning materials metals plastics rubbers best achieved clamped sandwich assembly yet achieving verifying! condition nontrivial. Each layer must made quite parallel. Even edge-clamped assemblies bow outward middle rather applying pressure needed. A common practice apply grease material layers eliminate air gaps. This practice disallowed wave connement tests. It clear demonstrated 6 even thin material layers alter HE connement properties. Contact must clean dry uniform. One may therefore ask grease layer recommended CYLEX test. The reason CYLEX primarily product connement test wave connement test. Consequently main goal maintain product connement preventing tube wall breaking prematurely. Planar Impact Experiments Planar impact experiments carried single-stage gas gun SNLs Explosive Compo 514 nents Facility. An illustration projectile target assembly appears Fig. 1. A projectile tted polychlorotriuoroethene Kel-F impactor launched 18-meter long 6.35-cm diameter barrel impact velocity 0.50 kms 1.15 kms. The stationary target assembly consisted Kel-F target cup mounted target ring xtured gun barrel exit. The cavity target cup nominal diameter 40.64 mm depth 29 mm. The stoichiometric KC-sugar powder mixture pressed target cup conned 25.4-mmthick polymethyl methacrylate PMMA window. A reector installed interface pressed powder bed PMMA window forming observation surface reected laser light ORVIS diagnostic. Impact velocity tilt projectile target measured shorting pins mounted side wall Fig. 1. Illustration gas gun projectile target The stoichiometric KC-sugar mixture contained 25.9wt CH brand powdered sugar 74.1wt potassium chlorate. Potassium chlorate Skylighter Corporation sieved remove particles greater 710 m. We report detonation size-effect data IMX-104 new insensitive explosive formulation composed RDX NTO DNAN. The size-effect data includes numerically predicted experimentally measured diameter-effect curves cylindrical-geometry rate sticks thickness-effect curves slab tests. These results used determine geometric scale factor relates explosive performance cylindrical geometry slab geometry. Both HNAB copperchromium confinement layers vapor-deposited promote intimate contact explosive confinement provide precise control layer thicknesses microstructure. Vapor-deposited HNAB films unique microstructure makes particularly wellsuited experiments.6 The films initially form dense amorphous structure largely independent substrate material small amorphous films subsequently crystallize room temperature period several weeks HNAB-II polymorph. Following crystallization room temperature films remain quite dense 99 TMD consistently gain well-dispersed array nanoscale pores. These films tend smooth RMS surface roughness tens nanometers independent film thickness. This low-roughness surface allows pristine interface overlying confinement layer confinement detonation behavior. In work confinement thickness varied nearly two orders magnitude determine minimum necessary behave though confinement effectively examine effects extremely thin confinement layers detonation behavior. These experiments also provide insight detonation reaction kinetics using minimum effectively infinite confinement condition give indirect measure reaction zone length. Both explosive confinement layers deposited custom designed high-vacuum deposition system onto 1 3 cm polycarbonate Makrolon substrates. Deposition typically performed base pressure 1 10-6 Torr. Note critical thickness tc fit experimentally determined failure thickness tf often similar values different significance. The critical thickness simply fitting parameter Eq. 1 direct physical meaning failure thickness empirical measurement explosive material unable sustain detonation. However since Dt - tc implies tf must greater tc. The ratio Atc provides non-dimensional measure quickly detonation velocity drops zero thickness approaches failure. For many pressed cast explosives ratio order unity.13 Larger ratios indicate gradual decrease detonation velocity larger range explosive thicknesses smaller ratios reflect smaller changes detonation velocity approaching nearer failure thickness velocity drops abruptly. For unconfined HNAB films ratio small 0.002 indicates detonation velocity changes little approaching near failure thickness steep drop velocity observed. For confined HNAB even smaller 0.0008 indicating even less change velocity approaching failure. This type behavior generally associated homogeneous explosive materials like liquid nitromethane heterogeneous explosives tend larger Atc ratios gradual decrease detonation velocity approach failure thickness.16 17 This suggests heterogeneities present HNAB films grains order hundred nanometers pores similar sizes smaller6 fine scale compared relevant detonation phenomena reaction zone allowing behave like homogeneous material.
